Activity: Arrive at the office and review yesterday's summary report. Check emails for responses from IT and Health Informatics colleagues.
Begin drafting the standardized data abstraction form. Focus on clarity, usability, and completeness. Design the form to capture all relevant EHR data elements.
Consult with @CLINLEAD-1 and @PCHMP-1 on the draft data abstraction form. Solicit feedback on clinical relevance and comprehensiveness. Topic: Review of Data Abstraction Form Draft
Incorporate feedback from clinical colleagues into the data abstraction form. Refine the layout and wording for clarity and ease of use.
Test the data abstraction form with a sample set of historical medical records (both electronic and paper). Identify any gaps or areas for improvement.
Lunch Break. Catch up on some online articles about film photography.
Revise the data abstraction form based on the testing results. Ensure that all relevant data elements can be accurately and efficiently captured.
Email @QATEST-1 and @QATEST-2 to arrange for testing the abstraction form. Topic: Request for the data abstraction form testing.
Prepare a training plan for the data abstractors. Outline the topics to be covered, the training methods to be used, and the schedule for the sessions.
Develop training materials for the data abstractors, including a detailed protocol, step-by-step instructions for EHR data entry, and quality control procedures.
Summarize the day's accomplishments, focusing on the development of the data abstraction form and the preparation of the training plan.
